params.roleId: the roleId to fetch the entitlement data for

params.user: the user to fetch the roles for

returns._0: roles array of all the roles for the user

params.channelId: id of the channel to check, if empty string, checks space
params.user: address of the user to check

returns._0: whether the user is entitled to the permission

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.entitlementData: abi encoded array of the data associated with that entitlement
params.roleId: id of the role to remove

params.entitlementData: abi encoded array of data necessary to set the entitlement
params.roleId: id of the role to gate

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

description().notice: The description of the entitlement module

getEntitlementDataByRoleId(uint256).notice: fetches the entitlement data for a roleId

getUserRoles(address).notice: fetches the roles for a given user in the space

isEntitled(string,address,bytes32).notice: checks whether a user is has a given permission for a channel or a space

moduleType().notice: The type of the entitlement module

name().notice: The name of the entitlement module

setSpace(address).notice: sets the address for the space that controls this entitlement

@notice allow the contract to be upgraded while retaining state
 @param newImplementation address of the new implementation
